ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] Hello All
ygData.msgSnippet: Vince/james I strongly recommend coming on over! It s a lot of fun! We have quickly become like a little family!  Heck some of us are family - from 3 brothers
ygData.messageBody:
Vince/james

I strongly recommend coming on over!
It's a lot of fun!
We have quickly become like a little family! Heck some of us are family -
from 3 brothers who play to people having their significant others on as
well!

And being a Dwarven Cleric - I would welcome any more clerics gladly!!
Our guild is already quite diverse and we all just recommend you pick a
character you want to play!
And you will find out that once you have gotten to a level - if you start a
new character it's easier to get up to that level, since you already know
what to do and what not to do!

Hamyrmint Forgewell (aka Jai)
20th Level Cleric of Kaladim
(Snappy! Seriously! I have no more mana to heal you stop attacking
Grimfeather!)

----- Original Message -----
From: "Vince Bowes" <vbowes1@...>
To: <EQ_rainbow@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 11, 2000 5:08 PM
Subject: [EQ_rainbow] Hello All


> Greetings:
>
> I just found out about EQ Rainbow through a long and contentious thread
> started on an Everquest newsgroup. My first response to hearing about EQ
> Rainbow made me laugh out loud: "My God, there are others like me out
> there!" I had wondered if there were any other gay/lesbian players
> around (I certainly hadn't met them).
>
> I am Vince Bowes, a Branch Supervisor of a public library in Toronto,
> Canada. I've been playing EQ off and on for about eight months. I have
> two characters I play frequently on the Tribunal server, but I am
> strongly considering ending them and starting over on the RN server
> because I am really curious about the Mystic Alliance...but it will be
> hard to drop my level 17 druid, Kestrelle. But it would be worthwhile to
> talk to other gay players and be part of a truly 'open' guild. Are there
> any openings for a high elf cleric in the ranks? That's a class/race
> combo I have been eager to try for some time.
>
> Cya in Norrath folks!
>
>
>
>
>
>
